answers.content_html: An electric current is induced if a bar magnet is placed near the wire loop.
answers.feedback_html: The change in magnetic field or change in area vector of a wire loop induces electric current in the wire.

answers.content_html: An electric current is induced if wire loop is wound around the bar magnet.
answers.feedback_html: If wire loop is wound around the bar magnet, it is not possible to make changes in flux. Hence there is no possibility of induced current.

answers.content_html: An electric current is induced if a bar magnet is moved through the wire loop.
answers.feedback_html: If a bar magnet is moved through the wire loop, the magnetic flux changes which induces electric current in the wire.

answers.content_html: An electric current is induced if a bar magnet is placed in contact with the wire loop.
answers.feedback_html: Either change in magnetic field or change in area vector of a wire loop induces electric current in the wire.
